allData.occupation: Freelance project and program manager in social real estate/ cultural sector

positions.title: Freelance
positions.description:
Program management, consultancy cultural real estate, Placemaking expert, change thinker, development and production of artistic programs and concepts.
Activities are based on a professional hands-on attitude.
Concept Development/ advise based on creative processes.

positions.title: partner/ member/ freelance
positions.description:
Expodium is an urban do tank.
 
Expodium is a collective of three [Nikos Doulos, Friso Wiersum, Bart Witte]. Through a variety of methods of artistic research, we generate vital information about urban areas and at the same time activate those areas and their users. We are a satellite at grass-root level; framing local developments in global discourse. We document, archive, contextualize and frequently publish information and knowledge generated through our practice. We work unsolicited and we are for hire. We work with an international network of artists, architects, academics and the likes for mutual brain-picking. We collaborated with and worked for housing corporations, local governments, museums, universities, festivals and art institutions. 

We stroll and awe.

positions.title: Management Team Member
positions.description: Responsible for the transition of the location that hosts the ambitious program of BAK, Basis voor actuele kunst.

positions.title: conservator/ concept development
positions.description:
Urban interventions, new strategies, co- organisation, innovation,   development processes, workshops, research trajectories

(1) -	‘‘Crossbench praxis’; a mode of criticality, the ‘uninvited outsider’ as someone who could create conflict in order to instigate a productive process’.*
-	How does one create a place of conflict that goes beyond the idea of compromising, and instead aims for innovation and new strategies?
-	 To challenge participants to become the generic force behind the ‘spark plug’, and to undergo a series of successive conflicts as the subsequent ‘offspring’ of that challenge.**


*	The nightmare of participation, Markus Miessen, Sternberg press (2010)
**	Waking up from the nightmare of participation , Nina Valerie Kolowratnik & Markus Miessen, Expodium (2011)

allData.headline: Freelance project and program manager in social real estate/ cultural sector
allData.summary:
Bart is a dedicated, proactive, and ambitious creative professional with a proven track record in project management, consultancy, and programming within the cultural sector, always with a focus on the urban: placemaking, cultural real estate, and education. He has the ability to combine his strong knowledge of the industry with a keen eye for social structures, the urban environment, and a changing society. Bart enjoys collaborating and exploring new possibilities to bring projects and programs to life. 
Since 2012, he has been working as a freelancer in the field of social and cultural urban development, alongside his involvement with the Expodium collective.

Bart has a deep passion and believe in the potential of the arts,  a passion for the built environment, practice-based research, activating social structures, politics, and the urban space. Therefor these themes are always at the core of his work.

Educated as an artist in Genk (Belgium), Melbourne (Australia), and Utrecht (Netherlands), Bart works both as a freelancer and as a member of Expodium collective. Within this Urban Do-Tank, he deals with assignments, all related projects, and developed systems to investigate specific local situations. 

Recently, Bart has been involved in art projects worldwide, such as in Detroit (USA), Incheon (South Korea), Belgrade (Serbia), Umeå (Sweden), Kuopio (Finland), Helsinki (Finland), and of course, in the Netherlands.
